description:
Massively parallel and GPU-accelerated non-orthogonal configuration interaction for large molecular systems.

GronOR started in 2016 as a collaboration of the Theoretical Chemistry group of the University of Groningen in Groningen, the Netherlands and the National Center for Computational Sciences at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, with the objective of developing massively parallel and accelerated computational chemistry applications.
name: GronOR
